page.title: 19OUR SCHOOL
page.content: 41 children come to this school from a wide and scattered area:from the A 6071 road on the west to a point about five miles east of the school.Most of the children are brought in by transport paid for by Cumbria Education Authority.Because of declining school rolls Walton School and Lees Hill School were amalgamated on this site in April 1971. This school employs 2.3(two and three tenths)teachers. The school is divided into three classes on three mornings of the week and into two for the rest of the time. We begin morning school at 9.00 and end at noon.Afternoon school begins at 13.00 and ends at 15.30.There is a break in the morning session of 15 minutes and in the afternoon of 10 minutes.Many of our school documents have been deposited with the County Archivist.
